definition: A network of fibers that provides structural support to the cell.
A small dense region within the nucleus where ribosome assembly begins.
The material of which the chromosomes of organisms are composed.
An organelle responsible for energy production in the cell.
The molecule that carries the genetic information of living organisms.
The complete set of genetic material in an organism.
The process of combining water and carbon dioxide to form carbohydrate and oxygen.
A protein that speeds up chemical reactions in the body.
An organelle found in plant cells where photosynthesis occurs.
A molecular machine that synthesizes proteins in the cell.
An organelle containing digestive enzymes to break down waste.
The jelly-like substance within a cell that contains organelles.
The control center of the cell that contains genetic material.
An organelle involved in modifying, sorting, and packaging proteins.
A network of membranes involved in protein and lipid synthesis.
The energy currency of the cell, produced in mitochondria.
A single-celled organism without a nucleus.
An organism whose cells contain a nucleus and organelles.
